questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The coefficient of static friction between a wooden block of mass 0.5 kg and a vertical rough wall is 0.2. The magnitude of horizontal force that should be applied on the block to keep it adhere to the wall will be ______N. [g = 10 ms⁻²]

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A resonance circuit having inductance and resistance 2 × 10⁻⁴ H and 6.28 Ω respectively oscillates at 10 MHz frequency. The value of quality factor of this resonator is _______. [π = 3.14]

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A hydraulic press can lift 100 kg when a mass 'm' is placed on the smaller piston. It can lift _______kg when the diameter of the larger piston is increased by 4 times and that of the smaller piston is decreased by 4 times keeping the same mass 'm' on the smaller piston.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An inclined plane is bent in such a way that the vertical cross-section is given by y = x²/4 where y is in vertical and x in horizontal direction. If the upper surface of this curved plane is rough with coefficient of friction μ = 0.5, the maximum height in cm at which a stationary block will not slip downward is ________ cm.
questions.concept: Angle of repose on curved plane

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The speed of light in a medium having relative permittivity εᵣ = 2 and relative permeability μᵣ = 2 is _____ × 10⁷ m/s. [Given: frequency of wave f = 5 GHz]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: When 9.45 g of ClCH₂COOH is added to 500 mL of water, its freezing point drops by 0.5°C. The dissociation constant of ClCH₂COOH is x × 10⁻³. The value of x is ________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer) [Kf(H₂O) = 1.86 K kg mol⁻¹]
questions.concept: Depression in freezing point and degree of dissociation

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: 4.5 g of compound A (MW = 90) was used to make 250 mL of its aqueous solution. The molarity of the solution in M is x × 10⁻¹. The value of x is ________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: At 1990 K and 1 atm pressure, there are equal number of Cl₂ molecules and Cl atoms in the reaction mixture. The value Kp for the reaction Cl₂(g) ⇌ 2Cl(g) under the above conditions is x × 10⁻¹. The value of x is _______. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Number of amphoteric compounds among the following is __________: (A) BeO (B) BaO (C) Be(OH)₂ (D) Sr(OH)₂

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The reaction of sulphur in alkaline medium is: S₈(s) + aOH⁻(aq) → bS²⁻(aq) + cS₂O₃²⁻(aq) + dH₂O(l). The value of 'a' is _______. (Integer answer)
